20110102030121.000|20110102030123.000|TR0|
20110102030123.000|20110102030126.000|TR0|Norwegian filmmaker Paul Refsdal first 
20110102030126.000|20110102030129.000|TR0|came to Afghanistan in the 1980s to report 
20110102030129.000|20110102030132.000|TR0|on the Mujahideen.  Now he returns on a 
20110102030132.000|20110102030134.000|TR0|dangerous assignment one that will take 
20110102030134.000|20110102030137.000|TR0|him to one of the country's deadliest 
20110102030137.000|20110102030140.000|TR0|regions.  It's an assignment that could 
20110102030140.000|20110102030143.000|TR0|get him kidnapped and killed.

20110102030154.000|20110102030156.000|TR0|

20110102030159.000|20110102030202.000|TR0|Because we've been fighting the Taliban 
20110102030202.000|20110102030205.000|TR0|for nine years.  I thought it was time 
20110102030205.000|20110102030207.000|TR0|that someone we met them and actually try 
20110102030207.000|20110102030210.000|TR0|to show who these people are.

20110102030815.000|20110102030818.000|TR0|
20110102030818.000|20110102030821.000|TR0|COOPER:  On October 3, 2009, Refsdal 
20110102030821.000|20110102030823.000|TR0|begins one of the most dangerous 
20110102030823.000|20110102030826.000|TR0|assignments of his career, going behind 
20110102030826.000|20110102030829.000|TR0|enemy lines to report on a group of 
20110102030829.000|20110102030832.000|TR0|Taliban fighters.
20110102030832.000|20110102030834.000|TR0|
20110102030834.000|20110102030837.000|TR0|There are many different Taliban groups 
20110102030837.000|20110102030840.000|TR0|fighting for many different reasons.  What 
20110102030840.000|20110102030843.000|TR0|they share is a strict interpretation of 
20110102030843.000|20110102030845.000|TR0|Islam.  In Taliban-controlled areas, girls 
20110102030845.000|20110102030848.000|TR0|aren't allowed to go to school.  Women 
20110102030848.000|20110102030851.000|TR0|must remain covered in public.
20110102030851.000|20110102030854.000|TR0|
20110102030854.000|20110102030856.000|TR0|Those caught violating Islamic law can be 
20110102030856.000|20110102030859.000|TR0|maimed or stoned to death.  Refsdal starts 
20110102030859.000|20110102030902.000|TR0|filming, aware of the Taliban's reputation 
20110102030902.000|20110102030905.000|TR0|for brutality, but unsure of who these 
20110102030905.000|20110102030907.000|TR0|fighters really are.  Everyone is tense.

20110102033749.000|20110102033752.000|TR0|a person cuts off another person's hand, 
20110102033752.000|20110102033754.000|TR0|then according to Islamic law, you have 
20110102033754.000|20110102033757.000|TR0|the right to retaliate and cut his hand

20110102033800.000|20110102033803.000|TR0|teeth, the eyes and the nose.
20110102033803.000|20110102033805.000|TR0|
20110102033805.000|20110102033808.000|TR0|REFSDAL:  His job is going around, having 
20110102033808.000|20110102033811.000|TR0|different courts.  If there's a thief, if

20110102033900.000|20110102033903.000|TR0|know? It's part of Afghan Islamic 
20110102033903.000|20110102033906.000|TR0|tradition to show mercy.
20110102033906.000|20110102033908.000|TR0|
20110102033908.000|20110102033911.000|TR0|COOPER (on camera):  How did it seem like

20110102033914.000|20110102033917.000|TR0|their area?     REFSDAL:  The local people 
20110102033917.000|20110102033919.000|TR0|was the Taliban.  These were people

20110102033928.000|20110102033930.000|TR0|
20110102033930.000|20110102033933.000|TR0|COOPER (voice-over):  And this is why 
20110102033933.000|20110102033936.000|TR0|Refsdal believes the Taliban will likely

20110102033939.000|20110102033941.000|TR0|for Afghanistan.
20110102033941.000|20110102033944.000|TR0|
20110102033944.000|20110102033947.000|TR0|REFSDAL:  In Afghanistan, a solution is 
20110102033947.000|20110102033950.000|TR0|power sharing, you know? It must be some 
20110102033950.000|20110102033952.000|TR0|way that the Afghan can live alongside 
20110102033952.000|20110102033955.000|TR0|other Afghans. You cannot continue this 
20110102033955.000|20110102033958.000|TR0|war forever.
20110102033958.000|20110102034001.000|TR0|
20110102034001.000|20110102034003.000|TR0|COOPER:  For now, Afghanistan remains 
20110102034003.000|20110102034006.000|TR0|gripped by war and fractured by politics.
20110102034006.000|20110102034009.000|TR0|
20110102034009.000|20110102034012.000|TR0|Coming up, Paul Refsdal's luck runs out.

20110102035244.000|20110102035247.000|TR0|word.  Paul Refsdal has gone from honored

20110102035249.000|20110102035252.000|TR0|on the line.  Refsdal begins to reason

20110102035255.000|20110102035258.000|TR0|REFSDAL:  Every time I kind of corner him 
20110102035258.000|20110102035300.000|TR0|in the discussion, it seems like he 
20110102035300.000|20110102035303.000|TR0|changes subject.  And every time the --
